Class TokenList

    • com.application.components.dtdParser.utils.TokenList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class TokenList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Manages a list of tokens.

    2.0
    Author:
    Ronald Bourret, 1998-9, 2001, Miguel Urízar Salinas
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • TokenList

        public TokenList(java.lang.String[] names,
         int[] tokens)
        Constructs a TokenList without a default.
        Parameters:
        names - Token names.
        tokens - Token values.

      • TokenList

        public TokenList(java.lang.String[] names,
         int[] tokens,
         int defaultToken)
        Constructs a TokenList with a default.
        Parameters:
        names - Token names.
        tokens - Token values.
        defaultToken - Default value (returned when a name is not found).

    • Method Detail

      • getToken

        public int getToken(java.lang.String name,
           int overrideDefault)
        Gets the token value for a particular name, overriding the default value if necessary.
        Parameters:
        name - Token name.
        overrideDefault - The temporary default value.
        Returns:
        The token value or overrideDefault if the name is not found.

      • getToken

        public int getToken(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the token value for a particular name.
        Parameters:
        name - Token name.
        Returns:
        The token value or the list default if the name is not found. If no list default has been set, 0 is returned.

      • initTokens

        private void initTokens(java.lang.String[] names,
              int[] tokens)
        Inserts in the hash the array of names and tokens. Names and tokens must have same length and their indexes must match
        Parameters:
        names - Array of strings representing the names
        tokens - Array of integers representing the tokens.
